body_html: Note: for split in tensor, we have split and split_with_sizes depending on the type of split_size, currently in script we could not be able to match the schema with split_with_sizes when providing an intList. This applies with other functions like index_add, index_fill, etc. We need to find a generic way to support them after @zou3519 and @zdevito changes.
body_text: Note: for split in tensor, we have split and split_with_sizes depending on the type of split_size, currently in script we could not be able to match the schema with split_with_sizes when providing an intList. This applies with other functions like index_add, index_fill, etc. We need to find a generic way to support them after @zou3519 and @zdevito changes.
body: Note: for split in [tensor](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/tensor.py#L264), we have split and split_with_sizes depending on the type of split_size, currently in script we could not be able to match the schema with split_with_sizes when providing an intList. This applies with other functions like index_add, index_fill, etc. We need to find a generic way to support them after @zou3519 and @zdevito changes.
